title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Fri Apr 13, 2018 | 7:32am   
Flares are set off from Fong Yang (FFG-933) Chi Yang class frigate (Knox class) during a drill near Yilan naval base, Taiwan. REUTERS/Tyrone Siu Reuters / Friday, April 13, 2018 Flares are set off from Fong Yang (FFG-933) Chi Yang class frigate (Knox class) during a drill near Yilan naval base, Taiwan. REUTERS/Tyrone Siu Close 1 / 24 
A devotee, dressed as Hindu God Shiva, looks out from a window as he waits to perform during the annual Shiva Gajan religious festival on the outskirts of Agartala, India. REUTERS/Jayanta Dey Reuters / Friday, April 13, 2018 A devotee, dressed as Hindu God Shiva, looks out from a window as he waits to perform during the annual Shiva Gajan religious festival on the outskirts of Agartala, India. REUTERS/Jayanta Dey Close 2 / 24 
A protesters shouts her opposition as CIA Director Mike Pompeo testifies before a Senate Foreign Relations Committee confirmation hearing on Pompeo�s nomination to be secretary of state on Capitol Hill in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A protesters shouts her opposition as CIA Director Mike Pompeo testifies before a Senate Foreign Relations Committee confirmation hearing on Pompeo�s nomination to be secretary of state   3 / 24 
A beachgoer stands still as a two-minute siren marking the annual Israeli Holocaust Remembrance Day is heard in Tel Aviv, Israel. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A beachgoer stands still as a two-minute siren marking the annual Israeli Holocaust Remembrance Day is heard in Tel Aviv, Israel. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Close 4 / 24 
U.S. Open Champion Sloane Stephens teaches tennis to 400 elementary students at a workshop in Compton, California. REUTERS/Lucy Nicholson Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 U.S. Open Champion Sloane Stephens teaches tennis to 400 elementary students at a workshop in Compton, California. REUTERS/Lucy Nicholson Close 5 / 24 
A relative of Arbaoui Walid, a victim of an Algerian military plane crash, mourns during his funeral in Algiers, Algeria. REUTERS/Ramzi Boudina Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A relative of Arbaoui Walid, a victim of an Algerian military plane crash, mourns during his funeral in Algiers, Algeria. REUTERS/Ramzi Boudina Close 6 / 24 
Brain Power ridden by Nico de Boinville falls down in the 13:45 Big Buck's Celebration Manifesto Novices' Chase at the Grand National Festival at Aintree in Liverpool. Action Images via Reuters/Jason Cairnduff Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 Brain Power ridden by Nico de Boinville falls down in the 13:45 Big Buck's Celebration Manifesto Novices' Chase at the Grand National Festival at Aintree in Liverpool. Action Images via Reuters/Jason Cairnduff Close 7 / 24 
Shi'ite pilgrims carry a symbolic casket outside Imam Moussa al-Kadhim's shrine to mark his death anniversary in Baghdad, Iraq. REUTERS/Khalid Al-Mousily Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 Shi'ite pilgrims carry a symbolic casket outside Imam Moussa al-Kadhim's shrine to mark his death anniversary in Baghdad, Iraq. REUTERS/Khalid Al-Mousily Close 8 / 24 
Actor and singer David Hasselhoff performs during a concert at the Friedrichstadt-Palast in Berlin, Germany. Markus Schreiber/Pool via Reuters Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 Actor and singer David Hasselhoff performs during a concert at the Friedrichstadt-Palast in Berlin, Germany. Markus Schreiber/Pool via Reuters Close 9 / 24 
Chinese President Xi Jinping delivers a speech as he reviews a military display of Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) Navy in the South China Sea. Li Gang/Xinhua via REUTERS Reuters / Friday, April 13, 2018 Chinese President Xi Jinping delivers a speech as he reviews a military display of Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) Navy in the South China Sea. Li Gang/Xinhua via REUTERS Close 10 / 24 
Women, photographed from the Chinese side of the border, are seen through binoculars fixed on a building on the Chinese side of the border for sightseers to look across to North Korea, as they cross the bridge from Namyang in North Korea towards the... more Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 Women, photographed from the Chinese side of the border, are seen through binoculars fixed on a building on the Chinese side of the border for sightseers to look across to North Korea, as they cross the bridge from Namyang in North Korea towards the town of Tumen in China. REUTERS/Damir Sagolj Close 11 / 24 
Model Janice Dickinson waits outside the courtroom in the Montgomery County Courthouse before testifying against actor and comedian Bill Cosby during the fourth day of his sexual assault retrial case in Norristown, Pennsylvania. Mark Makela/Pool... more Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 Model Janice Dickinson waits outside the courtroom in the Montgomery County Courthouse before testifying against actor and comedian Bill Cosby during the fourth day of his sexual assault retrial case in Norristown, Pennsylvania. Mark Makela/Pool via Reuters Close 12 / 24 
Palestinian relatives of Hamas gunman Mohammed Hejelah, who was killed in an Israeli air strike, mourn during his funeral in Gaza City. REUTERS/Mohammed Salem Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 Palestinian relatives of Hamas gunman Mohammed Hejelah, who was killed in an Israeli air strike, mourn during his funeral in Gaza City. REUTERS/Mohammed Salem Close 13 / 24 
A woman works on a bulletproof vest for children at the Miguel Caballero Company, near Bogota, Colombia. REUTERS/Jaime Saldarriaga Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A woman works on a bulletproof vest for children at the Miguel Caballero Company, near Bogota, Colombia. REUTERS/Jaime Saldarriaga Close 14 / 24 
A member of the LGBT community poses for a picture during a demonstration outside the Hall of Justice in Port-of-Spain, Trinidad and Tobago. REUTERS/Andrea de Silva Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A member of the LGBT community poses for a picture during a demonstration outside the Hall of Justice in Port-of-Spain, Trinidad and Tobago. REUTERS/Andrea de Silva Close 15 / 24 
A boy plays with water, during the Songkran Water Festival celebrations, to commemorate the Thai New Year in Bangkok, Thailand. REUTERS/Soe Zeya Tun Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A boy plays with water, during the Songkran Water Festival celebrations, to commemorate the Thai New Year in Bangkok, Thailand. REUTERS/Soe Zeya Tun Close 16 / 24 
Patients cover their eyes as they wait before their cataract surgery on the Lifeline Express, a hospital built inside a seven-coach train, at a railway station in Jalore, India. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 Patients cover their eyes as they wait before their cataract surgery on the Lifeline Express, a hospital built inside a seven-coach train, at a railway station in Jalore, India. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui Close 17 / 24 
A protester wearing a mask with an image of former Pakistani cricket player Shahid Afridi attends a protest against the recent killings in Kashmir, in Srinagar. REUTERS/Danish Ismail Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A protester wearing a mask with an image of former Pakistani cricket player Shahid Afridi attends a protest against the recent killings in Kashmir, in Srinagar. REUTERS/Danish Ismail Close 18 / 24 
A protester cuts branches from a tree for a barricade as French gendarmes continue an evacuation   Thursday, April 12, 2018 A protester cuts branches from a tree for a barricade as French gendarmes continue an evacuation   
Vendors sit under umbrellas inside a wholesale flower market in Bengaluru, India. REUTERS/Abhishek N. Chinnappa Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 Vendors sit under umbrellas inside a wholesale flower market in Bengaluru, India. REUTERS/Abhishek N. Chinnappa Close 20 / 24 
A Palestinian boy looks out a bus window, as he waits to travel into Egypt, after the Rafah border crossing was opened for three days for humanitarian cases, in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Suhaib Salem Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A Palestinian boy looks out a bus window, as he waits to travel into Egypt, after the Rafah border crossing was opened for three days for humanitarian cases, in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Suhaib Salem Close 
Jazmin Sawyers of England in action   Thursday, April 12, 2018 Jazmin Sawyers of England in action   22 / 24 
French President Emmanuel Macron arrives inside a classroom prior to a one-hour interview with French news channel TF1, at a school in Berd'huis, France. Yoan Valat/Pool via Reuters Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 French President Emmanuel Macron arrives inside a classroom prior to a one-hour interview with French news channel TF1, at a school in Berd'huis, France. Yoan Valat/Pool via Reuters Close 23 / 24 
A race during the Grand National Festival at Aintree in Liverpool. Action Images via Reuters/Matthew Childs Reuters / Thursday, April 12, 2018 A race during the Grand National Festival at Aintree in Liverpool. Action Images via Reuters/Matthew Childs Close
